intro: Scleria substriatoalveolata, commonly known as the narrow-ribbed sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, three-lobed flowers in clusters. It typically grows in wet or marshy environments, thriving in moist soils. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
